title: 10 Bible Verses for Wishing a Happy Birthday
text:
By Jack Zavada Updated February 28, 2017 . 
A birthday is a good time to reflect on God's love . We are each special to the Lord , unique and precious in his eyes. God's plan of salvation is available to every human being, so that we may enjoy happiness and life with him forever . 
The ancient Jews in the Bible rejoiced when a child was born. We, too, can rejoice in God's love with these birthday Bible verses. 10 Birthday Bible Verses 
Psalm 71:6-8 From birth I have relied on you; you brought me forth from my mother's womb. I will ever praise you. I have become a sign to many; you are my strong refuge. My mouth is filled with your praise, declaring your splendor all day long. ( NIV ) 
Psalm 139:13-14 For you created my inmost being; you knit me together in my mother's womb. I praise you because I am fearfully and wonderfully made; your works are wonderful, I know that full well.(NIV) 
Psalm 148:5 Let them praise the name of the LORD, for at his command they were created ... (NIV) 
Proverbs 4:10-13 Listen, my son, accept what I say, and the years of your life will be many. I instruct you in the way of wisdom and lead you along straight paths. When you walk, your steps will not be hampered; when you run, you will not stumble. Hold on to instruction, do not let it go; guard it well, for it is your life. (NIV) 
Proverbs 9:11 For through wisdom your days will be many, and years will be added to your life. (NIV) 
Ecclesiastes 11:8 However many years a man may live, let him enjoy them all. (NIV) 
Isaiah 46:4 Even to your old age and gray hairs I am he, I am he who will sustain you. I have made you and I will carry you; I will sustain you and I will rescue you. (NIV) 
1 Corinthians 11:12 For as woman came from man, so also man is born of woman. But everything comes from God. (NIV) 
Ephesians 2:8-10 For it is by grace you have been saved, through faith—and this is not from yourselves, it is the gift of God—not by works, so that no one can boast. For we are God's handiwork, created in Christ Jesus to do good works, which God prepared in advance for us to do. (NIV) 
James 1:17-18 Every good and perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of the heavenly lights, who does not change like shifting shadows. He chose to give us birth through the word of truth, that we might be a kind of firstfruits of all he created. (NIV)
